title: Romeo and Juliet
author: William Shakespeare
metaDescription: Parent curriculum guide for Romeo and Juliet. See what your child will learn week by week.
outcomes: Identifying and analysing dramatic irony in tragedy
Connecting textual analysis to tragic inevitability

weeks.title: Understanding the Text
weeks.description: Building foundational understanding of the tragedy
topics: Introduction to Romeo and Juliet and Elizabethan context
Understanding the feud between Montagues and Capulets

weeks.title: How the Text Works
topics: Exploring the central pattern: Prophetic Witnessing
Understanding how the ending is revealed in the Prologue
Recognising recurring motifs (fate, free will, light/dark)
Analysing how knowledge creates tragic inevitability

weeks.title: Analysing Key Techniques
weeks.description: Learning to identify and analyse Shakespeare's techniques
topics: Technique 1: Dramatic Irony (audience knowledge vs character knowledge)
Collecting textual evidence for each technique

weeks.title: Building the Argument
weeks.description: Developing a thesis and analytical argument
topics: Exploring the guiding question: How does Shakespeare use dramatic irony to create dread by revealing the ending before the play begins?

weeks.title: Writing the Introduction
topics: Drafting and refining the introduction paragraph

weeks.title: Body Paragraph 1
topics: Analysing the gap between character hope and audience knowledge

technique.name: Dramatic Irony
technique.description: The audience knows the lovers' fate from the Prologue, creating dread as they watch characters pursue hope toward inevitable doom.

weeks.title: Body Paragraph 2
topics: Building on analytical skills from Week 6
Exploring how characters speak more truly than they know

technique.name: Foreshadowing
technique.description: Characters repeatedly predict their own deaths, intensifying dramatic irony and tragic inevitability.

technique.name: Oxymoron
technique.description: Paradoxical language (loving hate, heavy lightness) reflects the collision of love and death that defines the tragedy.
